title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-5.7 - Comprehensive examination in lieu of attendance at basic course
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-5.7 - Comprehensive examination in lieu of attendance at basic course

State Regulations
(a) ORPTS shall
annually establish a comprehensive examination for the purpose of certifying
qualified persons as real property appraisers without satisfying the basic
course of training. (b) The
comprehensive examinations shall be of a character to test fairly and determine
knowledge, skills and abilities necessary for a person to perform the duties of
a real property appraiser. (c) In
order for an appraiser to qualify to take a comprehensive examination, he or
she must satisfy the minimum qualification standards set forth in section
8188-5.3
of this Subpart. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8188-5.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
